What: Cholesterol is a type of fat found in your blood.
Why: High levels increase the risk of heart disease.
How: Eat a low-fat diet, exercise regularly, and take prescribed medications.

What: Atherosclerosis is the buildup of plaque in the arteries.
Why: It can cause heart attacks and strokes.
How: Eat a healthy diet, exercise, and avoid smoking.
Symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, fatigue.

What: Myocardial infarction is a heart attack.
Why: It can cause permanent heart damage or death.
How: Recognize early signs and seek immediate medical attention.
Symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea.

What: Stenosis is the narrowing of blood vessels or heart valves.
Why: It can restrict blood flow and lead to heart failure.
How: Regular check-ups and treatment to manage symptoms.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, fatigue, chest pain.

How: Avoid stimulants, manage stress, and follow medical advice.

What: Endocarditis is the inflammation of the heart's inner lining.
Why: It can damage heart valves and lead to heart failure.
How: Prevent infections, maintain dental hygiene, and take antibiotics if needed.

What: Angina is chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart.
Why: It signals an increased risk of heart attack.
How: Manage stress, avoid heavy meals, and follow a healthy lifestyle.
Symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea.
